summary: With an unparalleled commitment to success and a personal philosophy underscored with competitive-edge, Albert Rocker captivates any audience from the stadium to the boardroom.Albert Rocker is a results driven, business professional designed to excel and conquer in all areas largely in part by his innovative, forward-thinking business acumen and refreshing perspective of and approach to the demands presented by corporate infrastructures and through his understanding and mastery of entrepreneurial leadership.While attending the College of Management at the Georgia Institute of Technology, Rocker enrolled in a number of business courses ranging from Sales and Operations Management to Accounting whereas he acquired the necessary tools in aiding him in a personal discovery of the multiple facets of the business world spectrum.In further pursuit of gaining corporate training and awareness, Rocker sought after internship opportunities with a number of reputable companies including Automatic Data Processing (a Fortune 200 organization), the most respected payroll outsourcing company in the world. On the fast track to success, Rocker soared with ADP, successfully transitioning within various departments of the organizational structure including relationship management, sales and client services.Upon graduating in May of 2011, Rocker made the heartfelt decision to forgo his senior season of football with the Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets to pursue an opportunity to work for the best software company in the world, Microsoft (http://www.jobsblog.com/blog/georgia-tech-football-player-goes-pro-at-microsoft). This was an opportunity Rocker felt would prove to be more beneficial to his long-term, professional business goals.As a result, Rocker received a Bachelor in Business Management with a concentration in IT and Entrepreneurship from the Georgia Institute of Technology and now works as a Technical Account Manager at Microsoft in Los Angeles, California.

summary: Administratiekantoor met meerwaarde uit uw cijfers !CijferMeester A. van de Pol is een klein en informeel administratiekantoor in Opheusden, dat zich voornamelijk richt in het uitvoeren van administratieve diensten voor bedrijven in het midden- en kleinbedrijf. Maar niet alleen ondernemingen, ook starters en particulieren willen wij graag van dienst zijn. Voor het opstellen van een gedegen ondernemersplan c.q. meerjarenplan staan wij u graag terzijde!Uit ervaring weet ik dat het belangrijk is om goed op de hoogte te zijn van de gang van zaken in uw onderneming. Zodoende is het mogelijk om adequaat te kunnen inspelen op de relevante ontwikkelingen die zich zowel binnen en buiten uw onderneming voordoen. Een goed gevoerde administratie staat ten dienste van de onderneming en niet andersom!Als u geld en tijd wilt besparen en zich volledig wilt richten op de kerntaken van uw bedrijf (het ondernemen) dan kunt u uw financiële administratie met een gerust hart aan ons toevertrouwen.Administratiekantoor CijferMeester A. van de Pol biedt een uitstekend pakket aan dienstverlening. Zo kunnen wij uw complete administratie (inboeken van in- en verkoopfacturen, bank, kas en andere documenten) uit handen nemen. Ook kunt u kiezen de administratie zelf te voeren met eigen software, waarbij wij alleen de controle en/of aangiften verzorgen. De salarisverwerking met alles wat daarbij hoort is bij CijferMeester in goede handen!CijferMeester werkt met een online administratieprogramma, met verschillende modules en heel veel gebruiksvriendelijke mogelijkheden.Vanuit mijn jarenlange ervaring kan CijferMeester u op een breed gebied een deskundig advies geven en u helpen de juiste richting te bepalen. Geen hoogdravende verhalen, maar gewoon met de benen op de grond. Helder – duidelijk – begrijpelijk, dat zijn kernwoorden die passen bij CijferMeester!

experience.title: Professor of Human Computer Interaction
experience.desc: I am at the University of Stuttgart in the computer science department and part of the SimTech Cluster of Excellence. I am heading the Human Computer Interaction Group in VIS.We are interested in how to create efficient and pleasant user interfaces for many application domains, including automotive UIs, mobile systems, and interactive environments. We use a wide variety of sensors (cameras, eye tracking, physiological sensors) to enable interaction with all sense.

experience.title: Professor
experience.desc: At the university of Duisburg-Essen am I the head of the Pervasive Computing and User Interface Group. I am teaching and researching in this area, with a particular focus on user interfaces for mobile devices and phones, human computer interaction in the automotive context, sensors and actuators forEdit

experience.title: Head of Department
experience.desc: I hold a joined position between the Fraunhofer Institute for Intelligent Analysis and Information Systems (IAIS) and the University of Bonn.My teaching and research interests are in media informatics and in particular in the areas of user interface engineering, pervasive computing and mobile interactive systems.

experience.title: Researcher
experience.desc: I am head of the Embedded Interaction research group in the computer science department at the University of Munich (Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München), Germany. My general research interests are ubiquitous computing, pervasive computing, and context-awareness. In particularly I am interested in novel user interfaces, tangible media and new interaction methods.I am involved in research and teaching.

events.summary: My goal is to shape future user interfaces, novel user experiences and new ways for interacting with information through my research and teaching.

events.summary: The world has highly advanced in the invention of technologies and in the provision of all the required IT gadgets to link the whole world and turn it into a small townHowever, most people and organizations still are not utilizing this effectively.How much information do we receive as noise or unnecessary info that we can live without! and how much information is missed out that we badly need to improve our lives! Most probably 60-75% of the information we receive daily is not so important except for some cases & the only little percentages are the ones that can make a change in our lives.Anyway, the above is not our topic today. Let us talk about business.Although we have more educated people in the world now compared to any time in the past, although we have so much available technologies at extremely low cost, or even free, we are still lagging behind in many aspects of success worldwide.As professionals, each of us has a strong role to play to slash out the barriers and start connecting people together to improve the world’s culture & management of information as well as communication.Knowledge sharing, authoring and/or forwarding structured information, communicating effectively, coaching, mentoring, guiding, advising, steering, helping, incentivizing, motivating, setting deadlines, tracking, leading by example, intervening, enforcing compliance and holding people accountable are some areas that we need to do more of.There are unlimited gaps in culture and in any organization and we as professionals need to provide and install the missing building blocks to seal off the unwanted holes.Wishing you peace & success,Yours sincerely,Humaid Al-Bulushi

experience.title: Start-Up/Commissioning - Systems Turnover (Rep. for GE)
experience.desc: GE Project / TransGlobal Energy, Inc. / April 2011 - June 2012Start-Up / Commissioning Systems Turnover (GE Rep.)New Construction CCGT–2000MW Power Plant Facility - Sabiya Power Station - Subiya, KuwaitMAJOR EQUIPMENT: 6-GE Frame PG9351FA (9FA) dual fuel Combustion Turbines, (2 per power block) 3-GE D11, Reheat Steam Turbine-Generators each equipped with a bottom terminals 50Hz 324 hydrogen cooled generator.Project consisted of (6) GE 9FA Dual Fuel Turbines, (3) GE D11 Steam Turbines and (3) HRSG’s, producing 53 primary systems and 713 sub-systems of those 231 were centerline power block. My direct involvement during “phase one” was to review the systems turnover packages for the Power Block portion, monitor the EPC construction progress for all disciplines by verifying work progress against turnover documentation and system turnover schedule, leveraging others as needed by discipline. Phase two - project required streamlining the overall process of systems turnover from EPC Construction/Pre-Commissioning, Power Block Commissioning to Client/Owner Handover. Subsequently this required to independently develop and improve the current Systems Completions processes in order to successfully achieve project milestones. Develop and manage OM Handover Walk-Downs, schedule and support team planning based on turnover from startup. Interfaced with the operating organizations, to determine specific requirements regarding preparation/acceptance for Final Handover and guided multi-disciplinary team “Core-Group” of 20+ members for the execution of Commercial Operation Systems Turnover. The successful completion/turnover was contributed to ensuring that all Joint Ventured and Client Representatives were notified for all turnover activities well in advance.

experience.title: Start-Up/Commissioning Systems Turnover (Rep. for GE)
experience.desc: GE - Shanahan / Start-Up - Commissioning Systems Turnover (GE Rep.)New Construction Combined Cycle 800MW Plant Facility Surgut, (Siberia) RussiaMAJOR EQUIPMENT: 2 - GE Frame 9FA’s, 2 D11 Steam Turbines and 2 CMI – EPTI, (HRSG)Developed/created processes to better streamline the over-all system turnovers. The procedures developed were very basic in nature thus, allowing for better adherence to the new process. The new process involved construction and commissioning disciplines to personally engage themselves in reviewing their respective portions of each sub-system requiring their signature as being mechanically complete, denoted in a turnover log. Weekly reports were submitted to GE Project Manager, Site Manager, and Commissioning Manager. Items tracked in these reports identified project required systems, accepted, rejected, under review, staged (up-coming based on system priority), system breakout - Unit #’s, Client Owned, Common, and so forth. Coordinate with GE and Gama regarding to the Turnover package for its Content. Monitor completion status for system(s) and Sub-system(s) based on pre-commissioning/Commissioning schedule. Tracked and reviewed all Turn-Over Packages for Mechanical Completion sign-off for accuracy and completeness of documentation for turnover to the client.

experience.title: Start-Up / Commissioning Systems Turnover (EPC - Rep.)
experience.desc: ProEnergy / Start-Up / Commissioning Systems TurnoverNew Construction 250 MW Aero-Derivative Power Plant, VenezuelaMAJOR EQUIPMENT: Pratt & Whitney FT8 Swift Pac’s & GE LM6000Interface with Construction, Start-up and Commissioning Groups. Provide assistance on contractual aspects to the construction group for preparation of short term schedules in support of successful completion and turnover of the systems to the Commissioning and Start-up Group. Provide direction for the construction group ensuring proper documentation is captured for each system turnover package. Additional Duties were to kick off the LOTO program, which resulted in my personally spearheading the program until we achieve provisional acceptance to the owner. The LOTO program is consistent with Industry standards such as; Verify safety tags and locks are in place on system boundaries before signing off the turnover package. Track the completion of all outstanding punch list items, adopting a “done-done” philosophy. Organize and maintained system turnover packages tracked turnover performance and reviewed the results with the Construction Manager and the Start-Up Manager. Routinely provide assistance required to support startup efforts ensuring compliance with the associated specifications, resulting in an efficient and timely system turnover to the client.

experience.title: PhD
experience.desc: I was employed as a PhD student in a large project funded by IOP Senter called 'Comparative and predictive transcriptomics of Gram-positive bacteria for enhanced food functionality, quality and safety'. The goal of this project was to generate predictive knowledge on the regulatory gene networks and metabolic pathways of four fully-sequenced, well-characterized, food relevant and evolutionarily related Gram-positive bacteria. Additionally I was involved in the setting up the microarray facility at the Molecular Genetics Group and designing the L. lactis MG1363 microarrays after sequencing the full genome of L. lactis MG1363. Other duties included the supervision of students and setting up Bioinformatics courses.Journal Publications:PMID: 18267014PMID: 17933937PMID: 17493129PMID: 17307855PMID: 16545511PMID: 15936843PMID: 15980536PMID: 14602937PMID: 12684515PMID: 12369183Thesis:http://irs.ub.rug.nl/ppn/304591076

events.summary: Gli anni trascorsi nel Gruppo Finmeccanica, prima in Ansaldo Energia e poi in Elsag, mi hanno consentito di maturare una significativa esperienza nell’ambito dell’Information Technology applicata a grandi e complesse realtà aziendali.Da Marzo 2001 a maggio 2006 sono stato responsabile delle Infrastrutture e dei Sistemi della società Voltri Terminal Europa S.p.A. (VTE), azienda multinazionale di proprietà di PSA Corporation (ex Autorità Portuale di Singapore), fino al 2003 partecipata dal gruppo Fiat, dove ho maturato significative esperienze di organizzazione aziendale, in ambienti internazionali, di architettura di sistemi, di sviluppi di progetti e di supervisione di gruppi di lavoro, coordinando degli aspetti tecnologici, progettuali e di gestione delle infrastrutture IT, garantendo la costante evoluzione e l'aggiornamento della piattaforma, delle tecnologie e della sicurezza coerentemente alle necessità di business.Da giugno 2006 sono il Responsabile della Gestione Sistemi di Coop Consorzio Nord Ovest, nato dalla volontà delle tre cooperative di consumo di Liguria, (Coop Liguria), Lombardia (Coop Lombardia) e Piemonte (Novacoop), nonché a circa 30 piccole e medie cooperative, soprattutto lombarde, di dare vita ad una struttura che centralizzasse la gestione commerciale, logistica e dei sistemi informativi.La sua missione è fornire servizi efficienti, efficaci e tecnologicamente avanzati alle Cooperative, consentendo alle stesse di dedicarsi alla ricerca dell’eccellenza nella vendita, sull’ascolto di soci e clienti e sullo sviluppo della rete di distribuzione. La nuova realtà aziendale è nata nel novembre del 2003 e già nei primi mesi del 2004 ha iniziato il processo di razionalizzazione e dismissione dei sistemi delle cooperative fondatrici e contemporaneamente la formazione e la crescita di una nuova struttura IT che fosse in grado di gestire tutta l’attività di Information Technology necessaria all’efficace gestione dei processi del Consorzio.

experience.title: VP, Global Human Resources
experience.desc: Responsible for all worldwide human resources initiatives of a 6,500 employee global pneumatics manufacturing company. Managed a team of 14 HR leaders from major operations including sites in the US, UK, Germany, Czech Republic, Switzerland, Mexico, China, India and Australia.•	Created a global human resources function where none existed before. This effort involved creating structure, processes and discipline around salary administration, recruiting, succession planning and performance management. Results included the consolidation of HR consulting, relocation services, recruiting and payroll administration under select vendors saving over $550K.•	Orchestrated the effort to leverage five independent IMI divisions, CEOs, CFOs, and HR Leaders to see the value of integrating 23 separate US insurance approaches, consisting of over 3200+ employees, into one common medical plan that resulted in a savings of $1M in the first year.•	Led the effort in conducting HR due diligence for two successful acquisitions in 2005 and 2007, which met financial and integration expectations.•	Spearheaded a comprehensive reduction-in-force process that outlined key steps necessary to plan, communicate and execute large-scale site closures and reductions. This process was used in five major Norgren reductions/closures across the US, UK and Europe and led to tens of millions in costs savings•	Orchestrated and led the effort of the Norgren Board members to evaluate and define the culture necessary to meet its 5-year plan of doubling sales revenue. Inclusive in this effort was the identification of company values and leader competencies.•	Produced and implemented a global succession planning process that led to a 60% improvement over three years of available successors in key positions; developed an international assignment framework across five continents leading to increased governance of over $1.2M in incremental labor cost.

experience.title: VP, Human Resources
experience.desc: Responsible for the worldwide human resources function of a 1300-employee global manufacturing company. Operations include manufacturing and service centers in Boulder, The Netherlands, Mexico and China.•	Led the effort to establish an eLearning strategy for Emerson Process Management, a group consisting of 17 divisions and over 15,000 employees. ROI for this platform over a five-year period exceeded 300%.•	Participated in creating a Leadership Development program for the Flow Group, a group of five Emerson divisions. Launched this initiative for developing future leaders within Micro Motion by enrolling 30 business leaders in the first year.•	Created an eHR strategy to promote an environment of self-help within our employees primarily using PeopleSoft and our HR website as the foundation.•	Revamped the division’s mentoring initiative, which involved the creation of program objectives, selection criteria and process, coaching skills for mentors, accountability for regular meetings and an annual survey. After one year under the new structure, 90% of protégés and mentors overwhelmingly indicated their support of the program and the value it brought the organization.

experience.title: Director, Human Resources
experience.desc: Responsible for the human resources function of the U S WEST Small Business Group, a 2000-employee, $2 billion operation that provides telecommunications products and services to small business owners in a 14-state region.•	Directed the Small Business Group HR team in hiring 965 management and occupational employees in 1999, reducing pre-employment screening cost from $293 to $38 per hire in our management sales centers.•	Provided the HR leadership necessary for the Small Business Group to assimilate into the Qwest organization at the time of the US WEST/Qwest acquisition.•	Created and implemented a comprehensive diversity plan that incorporated recruiting, training, minority and women-owned business spending, mentoring and community involvement into the unit’s business plan. Accountability tool for senior leaders created quantitative and qualitative improvement by over 40%.•	Directed the human resources efforts to expand sales staffing levels by 400 employees or 25% over a five-month period. Inclusive in this effort were the implementation of new pre-employment sales screens and the closing of four sales centers while simultaneously expanding four others.

experience.title: HR Manager
experience.desc: Responsible for all company human resource strategies, policies and programs of the North American chemical operations. Provided guidance to the President and his staff on HR issues.•	Selected by Solvay to attend an exclusive leadership conference in Belgium involving high potential managers (60 employees of 35,000) on a worldwide basis to work through business issues facing Solvay. At week’s end, our 6-person team was one of three selected to present in Brussels to the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer on critical human resources issues and our plan to address them.•	Developed and implemented a new company-wide performance management process and incentive pay plan that emphasized core competencies and individual and company critical success factors linked to the annual business plan.•	Developed a career structure and promotion criterion within the company that provides individual growth opportunities within a flattening organizational environment.

experience.title: Employee & Community Relations Manager
experience.desc: Throughout eight years with the Quaker Oats Company, held positions of increasing responsibility across multiple divisions and locations.•	Provided counsel to plant manager and staff on issues relating to hiring, firing, progressive discipline, collective bargaining agreement interpretation and employment law.•	Coordinated the HR effort for the acquisition and employee integration of Maryland Club Coffee into the Continental Coffee site.•	Selected as President of the East End Area Chamber of Commerce in the City of Houston and brought business leaders together to solve area problems.•	Developed comprehensive health & safety program, which reduced injuries and workers' compensation costs by $130,000. Improved departmental safety performance in all areas: OSHA Incident Rate (OIR), Days Away Severity Rate (DASR) and Lost Work Day Case Incident Rate (LWCIR) by aggressively identifying problem areas and correcting them.•	Championed change from a traditional position bargaining approach to a principled bargaining method that led to a successful 42-month collective bargaining agreement as principle spokesperson representing the company.•	Represented the Company and interpreted the collective bargaining agreement in all third step grievances with the local union of the United Steelworkers.•	Prepared plant for an Office of Federal Contracts and Compliance Programs (OFCCP) audit. Received Letter of Compliance from the US Department of Labor.

experience.desc: The Humphrey Program, as part of The Fulbright Program, brings accomplished mid-career professionals from developing countries to the United States for a year of study and related professional experiences. Its aim is to foster knowledge, mutual understanding and a basis for long-lasting relationships between citizens of the United States and their professional counterparts in other countries. Fellowships are selected based on their professional and academic accomplishments as well as their commitment to public service in both the public and private sectors. The program is designed to provide broad professional enrichment through a combination of activities tailored to each Fellow's interests. All Fellows participate in workshops and conferences that provide interaction with leaders from U.S. federal, state and local governments, multinational organizations, and the private sector.

events.summary: I’m an English teacher and translator. At present I teach adults who need English for specific purposes, mainly for work and travel, so their key goals are to communicate effectively across cultures, build social and business relationships, and get things done not only at the workplace but in everyday life.I am interested in different fields of study: phonetics and phonology, linguistics, pragmatics and discourse. I specialized in business, technical, and professional English. As a researcher, I find it fascinating the study of cross cultural issues, the differences underlining British and American English, and how the language is changing, featuring new words from the internet, and becoming more popular in day-to-day conversation.I grew up and spent much of my working life in Argentina teaching English as a Second Language and Spanish for foreigners. I’ve also lived in the US, where I taught ESL and Spanish as Second Language at middle and high schools. Also I’ve worked as a mentor for a Teacher Training Course at John Tyler Community College in Virginia. I’ve delivered workshops for teachers at FLAVA (Foreign Language Association of Virginia).

honors: LUCAS VAN DOMSELAAR – Gerente de Logística de Eco de los Andes – Octubre 2010

“El coaching fue una experiencia increíble. En mi experiencia personal, me ayudo a poder ver las cosas con una perspectiva diferente. Despersonalizar los problemas, no llevarlos a un terreno de vida o muerte, y poder aprender a entender al otro. Con ello, aprendí a resolver mejor los conflictos y encontrar alternativas que resuelven las cosas de raíz, satisfaciendo a todas las partes y manteniendo las relaciones intactas…de alguna manera, me hizo aprender a pensar con efectividad.

Por otro lado, el poder contar con alguien que maneje conceptos organizaciones, de management, financieros, etc, hace muy fácil la interacción y el diálogo. Ese punto también fue clave para que las sesiones sean efectivas y bien enfocadas. Sobre “Alejandro, la persona”, descubrí a alguien en quien confiar, abrirme para contar todo lo que me pasa sin sentirme juzgado y con mucha capacidad de comprensión"

events.summary: Alejandro Garcia Monterde is a financial and operational banking risk leader with broad international experience specializing in retail and corporate portfolio risk management in North America, Latin America, Western and Eastern Europe.He is currently working for BearingPoint Management Consultants as the Head of CEE Risk Management.Prior to that he worked for Capgemini Consulting Osterreich where he leveraged his extensive experience in Risk management within the CEE. At Raiffeisen Bank International's SME Risk Team between 2007 and 2010 he was directly responsible for overseeing and contributing to the development of the individual SME retail risk portfolios of Raiffeisen International’s subsidiary network banks in the CEE and CIS. More specifically he has focused his expertise within the SME areas of product development, streamlining credit granting processes, collateral evaluation techniques, formulating credit policy, x-selling and portfolio performance monitoring.He has worked in the risk management field for over 22 years of SME-linked experience in the North & Latin American markets with Canadian banks such as Central Guaranty Trust (now Toronto Dominion Bank), National Trust Mortgage (now Scotiabank) and, prior to joining Raiffeisen, with Gibraltar Consolidated Equity & Investments, a Canadian based international private equity/venture capital firm focused on providing innovative financing structures to SME businesses within North America and Western Europe.During 1995 and 2007 while working with Gibraltar Consolidated, he has focused mainly on the development, execution and monitoring of credit, operational and market risk strategies for the newly acquired venture capital accounts and various M&A activities for both Gibraltar Consolidated Equity & Investments and many of its clients.He frequently addresses professional associations and conferences in the fields of commercial & investment banking, public policy, and risk management.

events.summary: Alejandro Herrera es sociólogo. Su especialidad es la sociología de la tecnología aplicada en los procesos de innovación inducidos por los productos ICT en diversos sectores (salud, sector público). Cursó la Maestría en Ciencia, Tecnología y Sociedad de la UNQ, con dirección de tesis del economista de la innovación Fernando Peirano, actual Subsecretario de Políticas de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación del Ministerio de Ciencia y Tecnología de la Nación.Su escuela de análisis sociológico de la innovación es la Teoría Actor-Red, cuyo ámbito internacional de estudios aplicados es el Centre du sociologie de l´Innovation, fundado por Bruno Latour (CNRS, Francia). Esta escuela sociológica se basa en la aplicación de la sociología de observación participante, la economía de la innovación, y la ingeniería de diseño tecnológico.Herrera fue ganador de dos concursos internacionales de ponencias para Cumbres Tecnológicas de ITU (ONU, Ginebra) como key speaker, y elegido miembro seleccionador de ponencias en un Comité de Programa.Durante más de diez años se desempeñó en la división especializada en la creación de servicios tecnológicos corporativos y para el sector público del grupo Telefónica. Allí desarrolló diversas actividades de innovación (AI): diseño tecnológico-comercial, transferencia tecnológica, estudios sectoriales, modelos de adopción tecnológica, prototipos, soluciones sectoriales, papers y conferencias, y desarrollo de productos de frontera de innovación. Ingresó como vendedor consultivo en grandes cuentas: ANSES, Ministerio de Educación, Cancillería. En ese rol diseñó el enfoque comercial Agenda de Innovación de Cliente, cerró proyectos comerciales de magnitud, y profundizó el expertise personal en venta de tecnología que usaría en las AI.Columnista en El Economista y en PuntoGov, autor del Plan Nacional de Gobierno Abierto Social e investigador PNUD. Fue socio fundador de MEC. Es consultado por ejecutivos, emprendedores, y líderes del sector público.

events.summary: Actualmente y de modo temporal me encuentro en búsqueda activa de empleo, valorando las diferentes opciones que se me están planteando y siempre teniendo en cuenta el desarrollo profesional en preventa, en tareas comerciales y de gestión.Paso a describir todo lo hecho hasta ahora ya que mi trayectoria pasada y presente, es la que me abrirá puertas a un futuro prometedor.Desde noviembre de 2007 hasta septiembre de 2012 he estado trabajando para Instalaciones Inabensa, sociedad de Abengoa (multinacional con sede central en Sevilla).En esta empresa he desarrollado dos trabajos completamente diferenciados:- Una primera fase de seis meses (nov 06-may 07) y en una tercera fase (may 08 - actualidad) como Ingeniero de Ofertas realizando propuestas técnicas y económicas para licitaciones nacionales e internacionales tanto de carácter privado como público. He realizado junto con el resto de mis compañeros del departamento ofertas para operadores de telecomunicaciones móviles y fijos, Administraciones Públicas, en temas tan diversos como redes LAN y WiFi, instalación de sistemas radiantes, tendido de fibra óptica, obra civil, telefonía, videovigilancia, control de accesos...- Segunda fase (may 07 - may 08) como Coordinador de planificación en Proyecto de instalación de estaciones base para Wana (operador marroquí) en Casablanca (Marruecos).Anteriormente desde may 05-nov 06 trabajé en Ericsson Network Services en el departamento de Ingeniería, realizando proyectos para la Red Corporativa de Telecomunicaciones de Endesa. En este puesto se realizaban la valoración, anteproyecto y posterior ingeniería para la integración de las nuevas subestaciones de alta y media tensión en la red corporativa.Se realizaban además proyectos para la mejora de dicha red como la instalación de nuevos radioenlaces, nuevos tendidos de fibra y actualización de los equipos.

events.summary: I am a highly motivated, result-driven and quality-oriented medical informatics specialist with knowledge and experience in effective and efficient project management, instructional design and health informatics. I grew up in Buenos Aires (Argentina) and after receiving my M.D. degree from the University of Buenos Aires (UBA) I did one year of a Residency Program in Family Medicine at the CEMIC Hospital. Then I did a Residency Program in Medical Informatics at the Hospital Italiano de Buenos Aires (HIBA) being a 4 year program approved by the National Commission for Universities Evaluation (CONEAU) and the Ministry of Health as a medical discipline. I have extensive postgraduate training in clinical information systems. I have been project leader of HIBA’s Personal Health Record System Project for two years between 2007 and 2009 developing the interface linking of HIBA’s HIS terminology system to consumer health information based on SNOMED CT software. I have been working from November 2008 to March 2009 in the redesign and implementation of the Government of Buenos Aires City’s drug supply system which provides information for ordering medication from a centralized depot to the Buenos Aires City Hospitals. I have been working from June 2009 to March 2012 as Chief Medical Information Officer implementing an Ambulatory Electronic Health Record System (SIRIS Project) for Megasalud. This is a problem-based EHR based on several standards SNOMED CT, HL7, LOINC, Corba-Med developed in-house. Since April 2012 I am working as Medical Coordinator of Electronic Health Records at Clinica Alemana de Santiago and as National Coordinator for Health Information Standards at Ministerio de Salud de Chile introducing Terminology Standards into SIDRA Project (Sistema de Información de la Red Asistencial)

experience.title: Digital Design Engineer for autostereoscopic 3D Display.
experience.desc: Design, implementation and testing of digital systems on FPGA (Altera). Some of the tasks involved the design of a depth dependent blur (Adjustable depth of field filter), a view indicator (that helps to locate the right spot, in front of the display, to perceive the correct left and right view). Studying the actual implementation of the bilateral grid, a nonlinear 2D filter (in VHDL). I have adapted the VHDL code in order to improve the depth map of a stereo image. All these algorithms were initially developed in C++. The goal was to determine the best architecture to implement these algorithms in real-time and that best matches the C++ algorithms.

experience.title: (Embedded) Software Engineer at FEI Company - Interim Professional Technology
experience.desc: Investigate a problem reported in the CAN/CANopen protocol of Transmission Electron Microscopes (TEM). Within the limited time to complete this project (6 weeks) several simple, yet efficient CAN/CANopen protocol analyzer tools for FEI's Company proprietary protocol, were developed. The tools, developed in C++, allowed to analyze the CAN messages form a log file and find the causes of the problem. Starting from January 2012 the project was extended 6 more weeks to carry out tests that can help to find a solution of the problem that was found. Also I have developed a GUI for real time monitoring of the TEM's controller boards activity.

experience.title: (Embedded) Software Engineer at FEI Company - Interim Professional Technology
experience.desc: Find and correct a problem in the firmware for a C515C micro-controller. Due to the change in the C515C derivative (from LM to 8EM) several Scanning Electron Microscopes (SEM) and Transmission Electron Microscopes (TEM) control boards did not work properly. The problem was found and corrected within the stipulated four weeks for this assignment. A simple CAN protocol communication test were performed in the boards to check the correctness of the update. The required technical documentation was written and the changes in the code, files and documents were loaded into the company's version control system.

experience.title: Researcher - Circuits & Systems

With the help of is model an architecture for the digital linearisation system will be implemented.
